content.p: Graves' disease is an autoimmune disease in which the thyroid is overactive, producing an excessive amount of thyroid hormones. Some of the symptoms are heart palpitations and hand tremors.

body.p: Which system is impacted by the altered calcium levels in Graves' disease, according to the symptoms listed above?

response.feedback: Correct. Skeletal muscles and the heart are impacted by altered calcium levels.
Incorrect. The skeletal system is involved in calcium homeostasis, but it is not involved with the symptoms described here.
Incorrect. The urinary system is involved in calcium homeostasis, but it is not involved with the symptoms described here.
Incorrect. The digestive system is involved in calcium homeostasis, but it is not involved with the symptoms described here.
Incorrect. One or more of these systems is/are mentioned in this scenario and is/are related to calcium homeostasis.
